final_answer.precision_note: Result given to 3 significant figures, matching the precision of the NaOH concentration (0.150 mol dm-3).

method: First, calculate moles of NaOH used: n(NaOH) = c x V = 0.150 mol dm-3 x (23.40/1000) dm3 = 0.003510 mol. From the balanced equation H2SO4 + 2NaOH -> Na2SO4 + 2H2O, the mole ratio NaOH:H2SO4 is 2:1. Therefore, moles of H2SO4 = 0.003510 / 2 = 0.001755 mol. The volume of H2SO4 is 25.00 cm3 = 0.02500 dm3. Using c = n / V, the concentration of H2SO4 = 0.001755 mol / 0.02500 dm3 = 0.0702 mol dm-3.
checks: Moles NaOH = 0.150 x 0.02340 = 0.003510 mol. Moles H2SO4 = 0.003510 / 2 = 0.001755 mol. Concentration H2SO4 = 0.001755 / 0.02500 = 0.0702 mol dm-3. Calculation verified.
